title: Deep, Data-Driven Modeling of Room Acoustics: Literature Review and Research Perspectives
author: Toon van Waterschoot (Department of Electrical Engineering, KU Leuven, Leuven, Belgium)
relevance_why: The paper discusses advanced modeling techniques in room acoustics, specifically deep learning applications that could influence future audio processing methods, especially in relation to speech enhancement and sound field reconstruction.
background: This paper provides an extensive literature review on deep learning approaches in room acoustics, focusing on modeling techniques to improve sound field reconstruction and related acoustic measurements.
contribution: This work introduces a structured framework for classifying traditional room acoustics models and deep learning paradigms, assessing their strengths and weaknesses, while identifying future research avenues.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing room acoustics models primarily rely on physical principles or empirical data, often lacking non-linear processing capabilities.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon these approaches by integrating deep learning methods that utilize both geometric and wave-based information for more accurate modeling.

key_innovation: It proposes a conceptual framework for comparing traditional physical models with new data-driven deep learning techniques, identifying the strengths of integrating these methodologies.
real_world_impact: This review could guide future innovations in acoustic design and therapies for hearing impairments, leading to improvements in audio quality and intelligibility in various environments.
limitations: No limitations are explicitly mentioned by the author.

new_terms.room impulse response (RIR): **Room impulse response** is a characterization of how a room influences sound, capturing reflections, echoes, and absorption properties.
new_terms.deep learning (DL): **Deep learning** refers to a subset of machine learning involving neural networks with many layers, capable of directly learning complex patterns from data.
